data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
0.15.0

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Rename the package to kobuki_velocity_smoother. (#20)

This is to disambiguate it from other velocity smoother
packages that exist in the ROS ecosystem.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Make a few more style fixes for older cpplint. (#18)

This should make the style work for both older and newer
cpplint.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Update the README.md (#17)

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Don't install test artifacts. (#16)

This was a vestige from earlier when we couldn't figure out
how to do this nicely.  We now have better examples, so don't
install these test artifacts into the released product.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Minor cleanup of the includes.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove the internal accel_lim_w variable.

We can just get the variable as needed from the node parameter
database.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove internal accel_lim_v.

Instead, get the value directly from the node parameter database.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove decel_factor internal variable.

Just get it from the node parameter database when necessary.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove internal decel_lim_w variable.

Compute it as necessary, which should be fast.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove internal decel_lim_v variable.

Just calculate it on the fly, which should be cheap.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove speed_lim_w internal variable.

Get it from the node parameter database instead.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove speed_lim_v internal variable.

Get it from the node parameter database instead.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Remove the quiet internal variable.

We are already storing it in the parameter database in the node,
so just get it from there.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Make sure to allow other parameters in the list.

That's because the node object might be used for more than
one thing, so we should only look at parameters that we
care about.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Enable the style checkers, and fix the style to conform. (#14)

No functional change.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix the tests to work with modern ROS 2. (#13)

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Small fix to the velocity smoother. (#12)

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Fix the test so it works with 'colcon test' (#11)

* Remove trailing whitespace.

* Cleanup test.

This should make it a bit more suitable for "standalone"
testing.

* Make velocity_smoother test work with 'colcon test'.

It seems that 'colcon test' has a different execution path
than 'ros2 test', so we can't rely on the launch_ros_node
being available.  Make sure to create our own node, and then
use that for the subscriptions.  This also necessitated a
change in how the checking loop was done.

* [test] comment elaborating test breakout conditions explicitly

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@openrobotics.org>
Co-authored-by: Daniel Stonier <d.stonier@gmail.com>

data.author: Daniel Stonier
data.message:
[docs] readme, minor cleanup and parameter/topic name refactor (#8)

Modified a few of the parameter names and topics to make them less confusing. The rest is a copy and slight rewording of the tutorial from the old [ROS1 wiki](http://wiki.ros.org/yocs_velocity_smoother).

data.author: Daniel Stonier
